summary: St. Augustine is a city in Florida, founded in 1565 by Spanish explorers. It's the oldest European settlement in the United States that people have lived in continuously. The city was named after St. Augustine and served as the capital of Spanish Florida for over 200 years. It changed hands between Spain and Britain before becoming part of the United States in 1819. Today, St. Augustine is a popular tourist destination because of its historical sites, like the Castillo de San Marcos fort. The city has about 14,000 residents and is part of the Jacksonville metropolitan area.
title: St. Augustine, Florida
